channel.title: Integrating Eclipse IDE
channel.description:
well I would post this under general questions but ATM when i click most boards on this forum I'm getting a 403 error or something weird :| ... but anyways, here is my question, I've decided to start a new project, PI, and I was needing to know if there is a way I can integrate eclipse into a server with a lot of folders and files, for example if you have ever used eclipse, you know how if you was to write for example
[code=java]public int "noob";[/code]
or any failed code you would get an error on that line showing you that you messed up, well if I just open up a file that's NOT part of my eclipse workspace it wont show my mistakes I've checked, IDK if I'm missing something obvious :/ if you know what I'm talking about please respond because i feel like a nooblet ATM.

item.title: Integrating Eclipse IDE
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

No worries. Don’t forget to set your build path and run configuration path. If you need the xstream files etc. I can upload, just PM me.

Read full topic

item.title: Integrating Eclipse IDE
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Bobby Mr. Bobby
item.description:
@Mr_Bobby wrote:

ok i got it tyvm.

Read full topic

item.title: Integrating Eclipse IDE
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

There’s a little drop down box at the top left corner on the tool bar. Click it and select “New Java Project”.

When it opens up the next menu, select the radio button “Open from existing source”, select “browse” and open up the PI source folder.

Then ok it.

Ta da.

Read full topic

item.title: Integrating Eclipse IDE
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Bobby Mr. Bobby
item.description:
@Mr_Bobby wrote:

can you explain that a little better im kinda confused.

Read full topic

item.title: Integrating Eclipse IDE
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Just create a new Java Project, then use an existing source instead of creating a new one from within the workspace, and direct the existing source to your server folder ;).

Read full topic
